Its still pretty good for a competitive FPS but since they've overhauled all the menus and lighting/visuals BUTCHERED THE GUN SOUNDS, its just not cs anymore. Game play= good everything else= sold to the chop shop

I have never regretted a steam purchase more than this one.  My experience wasn't worth any asking price, and it's certainly not worth picking it up for free either.  Cheaters and trolls are utterly embedded in its extremely toxic community, you can't go a single game without running into multiple and it's damn near impossible to find a pleasant experience in thousands of hours of gameplay.

Valve's anti cheat is a complete joke and it's clear they can't detect or punish wall hacks, or basically anyone that toggles their cheats on and off.  The community can't figure it out either with their single shared braincell, all you have to do to get away with cheats on a daily basis is play dumb for the last 30 secs of a round, nevermind that you were blatantly staring through walls and locking on for the first minute.

CS was once a fantastic series, immensely fun to play with a fun but chill community.  It hasn't been that for a long time now and there are just no real consequences for any of these players behavior.  Valve has given up trying and so have I.

I'm done with this franchise, I'm done wasting any of my time or thought on this.
